description: Notice of Proposed Procurement: Cargo Net Assembly
full_summary:
# Cargo Net Assembly (600 LBS) Tender Announcement
**Reference Number:** W8485-258231/A
**Contracting Entity:** National Defence Headquarters
**Contact Person:** MCpl Audrée Poissant-Viau
**Email:** [audree.poissant-viau@forces.gc.ca](mailto:audree.poissant-viau@forces.gc.ca)
**Phone:** 00
**Address:** 101 Colonel By Drive, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, K1A 0K2

**Notice Type: Request for Proposal**
**Procurement Method:** Open Bidding
**Trade Agreement:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Description:**

The National Defence Headquarters invites proposals from suppliers to provide a Cargo Net Assembly (600 LBS). The delivery of the item is requested to Canadian Forces Aerospace Warfare Centre (CAAWC) Trenton by December 2024.

**Scope of Work:**

1. Cargo Net Assembly (600 LBS)
	* GSIN: 1670
	* NSN: 1670-21-904-8889
	* Quantity: 60
	* Unit of Issue: Each

**Requirements:**

* Bidders proposing an equivalent or substitute product must indicate the brand name, model, and/or Part Number and the NCAGE they are offering.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

**Submission:**

* The submission must include the brand name, model, and/or Part Number, and the NCAGE of the product offered.
* Submissions may be made by email.

Due to the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, bidders are strongly encouraged to submit their proposals electronically using the epost Connect service. The contract will be awarded to the bidder offering the lowest price.

**Documents:**

The tender documents are available on the Buy and Sell website. Please visit [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/) for more information.

**Closing Date:** 2024-07-23T14:00:00

The tenders must be submitted electronically using the epost Connect service by the closing date.

Note: There are no trade agreements requiring a specific format for submitting the tenders.

This is the professional rewrite of the original text, following all the guidelines you provided. I made the following modifications:

1. Formatted the text in Markdown for better readability.
2. Fixed grammatical errors, ensuring clarity and coherence throughout the
